sp.speaker: FRAULEIN SCHNEIDER:
sp.p: Herr Schultz! Can I believe what I see? (HERR SCHULTZ nods proudly) But this is — too much to accept. So rare — so costly — so luxurious.

sp.l: If you bought me diamonds, If you bought me pearls,
If you bought me roses like some other gents
sp.stage: (She takes a large pineapple out of the bag)

sp.speaker: SCHULTZ:
sp.l: To keep from fainting dead away,

sp.speaker: BOTH:
sp.l: Ah, ah, ah, ah, ah, ah, ah, ah

sp.speaker: FRAULEIN SCHNEIDER:
sp.p: But you must not bring me any more pineapples! Do you hear? It is not proper. It is a gift a young man would present to his lady love. It makes me blush!
